Necklaces of elemental augmentation were pieces of enchanted tourmaline jewelry created to argument a spellcasters cantrip magic sometime before the late 15 century DR.
Tourmaline stone inlaid in the necklace radiated heat, almost too hot to wear. This internal energy was the enchantment that strengthened certain types of cantrips. All cantrip spells that dealt acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage had their damage output increased in accordance with the casters spellcrafting prowess.
As of the , a necklace of elemental augmentation belonged to the Inquisitor Wwargaz of Cr√®che Yllek. The magic jewelry was stored in Wwargazs quarters in the ruined Rosymorn Monastery.
